# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Data

df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2020, 5, 24), DateTime(2021, 1, 15), DateTime(2022, 12, 5)])
add_yearmonth(df)

Here is a Julia function that solves the problem:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> year(x)*100 + month(x), df.dt)
    return df
end
```

This function uses the `map` function to apply a function to each element in the column `dt`. The function extracts the year and month from the date, multiplies them together (to get a number in the range 2001-2099), then adds 2000 to shift into the range 2001-2099.

You can use this function like so:

```julia
df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2020, 5, 24), DateTime(2021, 1, 15), DateTime(2022, 12, 5)])
add_yearmonth(df)
```

This will add a new column `ym` to the DataFrame. The values in this column are the year and month of each date combined into an integer in the format “yyyymm”.
